results.title: Above the gorge
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Studies of the Wedge-tailed eagle, Australia’s largest bird, on the Nullarbor Plain in Western Australia, where CSIRO scientists are researching the life-cycle of the eagle, and in Western Victoria where it is regarded as an efficient controller of rabbits. Cinematographer: Keith Taylor.

results.title: At the edge of the salt plain
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Birdlife on Townsville Common, showing the osprey, kite, plover, jabiru stork, egret, spoonbill, and heron. Concentrates on the Australian crane, the brolga and in particular its courtship dance,

results.title: Antarctic winter
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.
results.description:

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.

results.title: Albatross Island
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Describes Albatross Island (Tasmania), the home of the white capped Albatrosses. Reveals various aspects of their life.

results.title: Divide and conquer
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra, Signal Corp and United States. War Dept. Special Services Division
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Why we fight”.
This third film in the “Why we fight” series records the German invasion of Denmark, Poland, Norway, Holland, Belgium, Luxembourg and France, illustrating methods of attack and emphasising the part played by propaganda and the fifth column in the campaign. Concludes with the surrender of France, including sequences on the evacuation of Dunkirk and the emergence of General de Gaulle as the leader of French resistance outside France. Commentator: Walter Huston.

results.title: Prelude to war
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Why we fight”.
First in a series of documentaries made to acquaint soldiers with the causes and events leading up to the U.S.A.’s entry into World War II. This episode concentrates on the threat posed by the rise of German/Italian fascism and Japanese imperialism to world freedom. Narrated by John Huston. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Why we fight
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Anatole Litvak and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: Frank Capra was assigned by the United States government to make seven orientation films to explain to more than nine million Americans in uniform the reasons for United States entry into World War II.

results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.
